1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Elihu, the name of one of Job's friends, and of three Israelites

2.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)

4.brief: properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

6.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to lie (i.e. deceive), literally or figuratively
to be frail, feeble, or (figuratively) melancholy
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.

7.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

8.brief: adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

9.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be familiar with; by implication, to minister to, be serviceable to, be customary
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
literal fora profaned thing; used (interj.) far be it!
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

near, with or among; often in general, to

near, with or among; often in general, to
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
